name: Mussels Pomodoro
author: Chef and a Baker
summary: These mussels have a fresh tomato basil broth with white wine and lobster stock and a duck-fat grilled crostini.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon duck fat, or more as needed
1 bunch fresh basil leaves, sliced very thinly
directions: Heat olive oil in saucepan over medium heat
Add shallots and garlic; cook and stir until softened, 1 or 2 minutes
Pour in white wine, lobster stock, and tomato sauce
Increase heat to medium-high and bring to a simmer
Cover and cook until mussels open, 4 to 6 minutes
Discard any mussels that don't open
Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler
Rub baguette with duck fat on cut sides
Place on a baking sheet and set under broiler
Broil until browned and crunchy, 1 to 2 minutes
